activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moua Chou Yang

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Moua Chou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared by video with Moua Chou Yang.  Attorney Michael Schiek appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF99, 22CF192, 22FO1052.  Magallones statement-not resolved at this time, requests additional PTC; requests bond be addressed; defendant currently serving a 6 mos. conditional jail sentence out of Marathon County. Magallones requests bond be amended to signature in order to allow Huber. Schiek statement-no objection to bond modification. Court statement - amends cash bond in 22CF192 to $3,500 signature bond with same conditions - no intoxicants/no taverns. Bond was posted in 22CF99. Adj. 10:38 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:33 PM Defendant Moua Chou Yang appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Moua Chou Yang. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF192, 22CF99 & 22FO1052. 22CF192 set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski states has complied with victim rights. Victim statement to next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 02:37 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Moua Chou Yang not in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Moua Chou Yang. 
Court statement to status- Defendant had requested to appear via zoom again today as he did not have a ride- was denied and advised to contact his counsel.  
Magallones statement - Agreement was reached for this case - has hearing in Marathon county and facing some jail time.  Sowinski statement - Court will not authorize warrant at this time- Magallones to arrange zoom appearance from Marathon County . If he did not appear in marathon or report to jail - court would authorize warrant.
Need further action scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:00 am.

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Moua Chou Yang appeared by video. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Moua Chou Yang. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court in recess 02:31 PM.  Back on record 02:35 PM. Parties remain same. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Defendant to appear in person at next appearance. Court verifies dates and time of next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 02:38 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. Bail continued. adj. 03:22 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Moua Chou Yang appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond. Defendant statement to next court date. adj. 01:25 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
